body.name: A Storm of Infinite Beauty: A Novel
body.description: From the bestselling author of Beyond the Moonlit Sea comes an atmospheric tale of how one woman’s search for the truth uncovers long-hidden secrets and rocks the very foundation of her world.Scarlett Fontaine is a true Hollywood legend—a singer, actress, and beloved fashion icon. But Scarlett dies tragically at just thirty-six years old, leaving behind no children. Or so the story goes…Gwen Hollingsworth is the curator at a museum dedicated to Scarlett’s life. She’s also sole heir to Scarlett’s fortune as a descendant of the star. But all is not well in Gwen’s world. She’s dealing with a messy marital separation and is struggling to move forward. So when Peter Miller, a biographer and photojournalist, comes to the museum with shocking claims about Scarlett—a life of exile in Alaska, a baby born in secret—Gwen’s whole world is turned upside down. Again.Determined to uncover the truth, Gwen and Peter set out for Alaska together but soon find themselves on a path toward something far deeper and more meaningful than either of them ever expected.A Storm of Infinite Beauty takes readers on a breathtaking journey from a lush vineyard in Nova Scotia to a rustic lodge in Alaska where old family secrets are revealed and the quest for true happiness begins. Read more

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #153 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #3 in Friendship Fiction (Kindle Store) #5 in Women's Historical Fiction #10 in Mothers & Children Fiction

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Ms. MacLean has given her readers a beautiful novel of the value of family, the importance of history, and incredibly strong women. It's tragicly sad, uplifting, inspiring; a story of recognizing beauty where you least expect to find it. Finding kindness and compassion for those less fortunate. Heroes and villains, curmudgeons, and generous souls.This book would be a wonderful choice for book clubs and will be among my top 20 list of most enjoyable reads.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love Julianne MacLean
reviews.reviewText: “Life was a gift— horrendous at times but also beautiful in its everyday miracles.”Julianne MacLeanA Storm of Infinite Beauty2023⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 4 StarsI really enjoyed this novel. A mystery to uncover about the famous Hollywood legend, Scarlet Fontaine. Peter & Gwen set out to Alaska to discover the untold truth about Scarlet’s secret time there. While in Alaska Gwen, discovers her own truth about her troubled marriage. A heartbreaking and emotional story. But also inspiring and beautiful. This story includes:🌄Historical Fiction🌄Romance🌄Family Drama🌄Secrets🌄Mystery🌄Emotional🌄Shifting POV & timelinesJulianne MacLean has become one of my favorite authors. If you like Kristin Hannah & Taylor Jenkins Reid, you’d love Julianne’s books too. I highly recommend her other books:A Fire Sparkling✨WW2✨Historical Fiction✨Romance✨Courageous WomenThese Tangled Vines🍷Historical Fiction🍷Italian Vineyard🍷Family Secrets🍷RomanceBeyond the Moonlit Sea🌙Historical Fiction🌙Romance🌙Instant love🌙Family Drama🌙Secrets🌙Mystery

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book and have read several other of her books as well. She “pulls” you in to the story by almost making you feel like you personally know the characters. You also can almost picture yourself as being part of the settings.I would highly recommend this book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars AMAZING BOOK COULDN'T PUT IT DOWN
reviews.reviewText: This book tells two stories: In the present day it tells the story of Gwen who has suffered the heartbreaking loss of a baby that subsequently ended her marriage and Valerie, who later became a famous movie star and song writer who lived in Alaska during the big earthquake of 1964. Both stories were beautifully told and unfolded in such a way that I couldn't put the book down. I loved Gwen and Valerie and cried at times as I read about their lives and their heartbreak. The supporting characters were also richly drawn and two of them were brought from 1964 Alaska to the present day where they completed the story of Valerie. This book was beautifully written with both stories complimenting one another.This is the first book that I have read by this author and I will be reading more of her work in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A lovely story
reviews.reviewText: Another gem found on Kindle unlimited (I swear there are so many good books out there, unheard of, that if you take a chance and read them you find such enjoyment!) A blend of present that becomes intertwined with a great story from the past. Just a lovely book all around! ps If you’ve ever traveled to Alaska where much of the story takes place you will love this. It captures the beauty of Alaska perfectly!)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Alaska is an extremely beautiful place that I was fortunate to experience. The story, was just ho-hum for me. I honestly was bored, and it was tedious to finish. I didn’t hate it. It was just not for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I could NOT put this down.
reviews.reviewText: Excellent story, capturing your imagination and keeping the pace up high.I enjoyed the character development and the descriptive scenery.Great for anyone having dealt with the loss of a child or a loved one. Also, good to see not everyone has to follow the cookie cutter life route.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this story from beginning all the way to the end. She is an awesome writer. I will read more of her books.

The author has given us a novel, with a great story. Living in the Yukon and having visited the East Coast, the sights described so well, took me there with all my senses enjoying the nature, smells, sounds.Well done in pulling the story together. Grateful that the ending was what I had hoped for, for our main character!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very good book great author fist Time I have read one of her books great story great characters loved the ending
One of the best book I have ever read.. couldn't put it down...had goose bumps, cried...all characters richly portrayed and the story well woven..
liked the story, bit sad but enjoyed reading

Julianne has, once again, written a story that reminds us that life is only a journey, and that, sometimes, we learn from others.She runs parallel stories seamlessly. If anything this story reminded me that there are no coincidences in life; every step, every encounter, every truth discovered, are only leads to a better place, to a place of healing, to a new perspective, and wiser choices. Gwen and Peter grow during this truth seeking journey about an artist whose life choices defied the norms of her time. Over all, it is a story of healing from losses and of growth, and this is what I like the most about Julianne's novels. They are not mere entertaining stories. They come with tidbits of wisdom, and plenty of worthy reminders.Thank you Julianne.
